senses.sense_definition: One of the series of sharp, triangular points along the cutting edge of a saw.

examples.text: Be careful when handling the blade, as every <w>sawtooth</w> is extremely sharp.
The carpenter examined the <w>sawtooth</w> edge to see if it needed sharpening.

senses.sense_definition: A waveform or signal that rises linearly and drops abruptly, resembling the shape of saw teeth.

examples.text: The synthesizer uses a <w>sawtooth</w> to create a rich and buzzing tone.
On the oscilloscope, the signal appeared as a perfect <w>sawtooth</w> repeating over time.

senses.sense_definition: A repeating pattern in data or populations characterized by gradual increases followed by sharp declines.

examples.text: The graph of the cell population showed a distinct <w>sawtooth</w> over several generations.
Economic cycles sometimes exhibit a <w>sawtooth</w> of slow growth and rapid recession.

senses.sense_definition: A type of butterfly belonging to the genus Prioneris.

examples.text: The entomologist was excited to find a rare <w>sawtooth</w> resting on the foliage.
We observed the flight pattern of the <w>sawtooth</w> near the forest edge.
